comments.comment: I do not see the point in condemning this woman for knowing her limits and providing a consensual service to those that need it in order to make  money. It‚Äôs a job, and she is obviously doing something that brings people satisfaction. I enjoy when my barista takes the time to make amazing latte art. And i don‚Äôt feel taken advantage of when I tip that person, knowing they did it for the tip, yet it also brightened my day and brought joy to my life. I‚Äôm so tired of judgy people imposing their rigid standard of expectation on all others. YES there is a line that SHALL NOT BE CROSSED, and some awful things in this world that people-both men and women do for money (you can rent a boyfriend here too folks, ive seen more than one doc on this subject) but i do not see her as one of those awful people, worthy of such harsh criticism and judgment. ‚ÄúI only participate in wholesome activities. Since I don‚Äôt dink alcohol, I won‚Äôt go out if they require me to drink‚Äù. 4:25  She‚Äôs a lot more ‚Äúwholesome‚Äù than some friends i know who are out looking for the wrong thing. Either way...irregardless, It‚Äôs just not our place to say.... And props to her for having guts to go on film and owning herself fully for who she is and what she does. It‚Äôs cool- she‚Äôs the ‚ÄúMeow Girl‚Äù folks!‚úåüèºüê± ‚ô•Ô∏è
